issue.title: Request to Remove haafedk2.com from AdGuard Filters
issue.body:
### Website Problem Report

**URL:** https://haafedk2.com

**Problem:**
My website was previously added to AdGuard's filters (possibly `BaseFilter` or `antiadblock.txt`) due to misclassification or use of ad-related scripts. These issues have been resolved. The website is now clean and compliant with security standards.

It has already been cleared by:
- Google Safe Browsing
- VIPRE
- CRDF
- PhishTank
- X-Force IBM
- ESET and others

**Request:**
Please review and remove `haafedk2.com` from any filter lists (e.g., BaseFilter, antiadblock.txt) to restore normal functionality for AdGuard users.

Thank you!

issue.title: mainichi.jp

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@list-kr/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/issues).

issue.title: App Store: 1669714867
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://apps.apple.com/fr/app/brevo-phone/id1669714867](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fapps.apple.com%2Ffr%2Fapp%2Fbrevo-phone%2Fid1669714867) ### Comment > Bonjour, > Les deux applications iOS de lentreprise de communication franaise "Brevo" nommes "Brevo Conversations" et "Brevo Phone" sont totalement bloques par AdGuard depuis quelques jours et uniquement sous iOS. Les services fonctionnent correctement sous Windows avec lutilisation de lextension AdGuard sous Chrome. issue.title: Request to Remove haafedk2.com from AdGuard Filters
issue.body:
### Website Problem Report

**URL:** https://haafedk2.com

**Problem:**
My website was previously added to AdGuard's filters (possibly `BaseFilter` or `antiadblock.txt`) due to misclassification or use of ad-related scripts. These issues have been resolved. The website is now clean and compliant with security standards.

It has already been cleared by:
- Google Safe Browsing
- VIPRE
- CRDF
- PhishTank
- X-Force IBM
- ESET and others

**Request:**
Please review and remove `haafedk2.com` from any filter lists (e.g., BaseFilter, antiadblock.txt) to restore normal functionality for AdGuard users.

Thank you!

comment.body: Next time you encounter a problem, please report it as a bug and include relevant information. This report does not help much, as it does not describe what is broken on the site. I took a quick look, I assume you are referring to the anti-adblock being triggered for AdGuard users.

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/?cid=dchk-commonheader](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww3.nhk.or.jp%2Fnews%2F%3Fcid%3Ddchk-commonheader) ### Comment > This is a follow-up to [the previous issue](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/206293). Although it was closed as "Cannot reproduce", I am still able to reproduce it, so Id like to provide detailed steps. > > As I mentioned in my previous report, the issue occurs when the AdGuard Tracking Protection filter is enabled. As you may know, filter changes take some time to take effect in Safari, so please wait a few seconds or restart Safari if necessary. > > 1. Please visit https://www.nhk.or.jp and click any link while the AdGuard Tracking Protection filter is enabled. For this demo, I clicked the link highlighted in the red rectangle in the attached screenshot. > 2. You should now see that the URL includes the "cid" parameter. In this case, its "?cid=dchk-commonheader". > 3. Please disable the AdGuard Tracking Protection filter and visit https://www.nhk.or.jp again, then click the same link as in Step 1. > 4. You should now see that Safari loads the URL without the parameter. If the parameter is still visible, please try restarting Safari. > > I suspect this issue occurs because the AdGuard Tracking Protection filter conflicts with Safaris tracking protection feature. If thats the case, this issue might not be limited to https://www.nhk.or.jp, but may also occur on other websites. Although Im not certain about this, Ive noticed many other URLs with similar parameters. However, I haven't tested whether the AdGuard Tracking Protection filter actually affects those URLs. > > Thank you for your continued support. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/su45hdyoqf440soww8808skcc844k8s2b2g54dluxc.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/469l6fjsv9kwwoogwwgcowo8o84kccsfklvyhw1o4g.png?nc=1)

pull_request.title: Bump lint-staged from 16.0.0 to 16.1.0
pull_request.body:
Bumps [lint-staged](https://github.com/lint-staged/lint-staged) from 16.0.0 to 16.1.0.
Release notes

Sourced from lint-staged's releases.

v16.1.0

Minor Changes

  • #1536 e729daa Thanks @iiroj! - A new flag --no-revert has been introduced for when task modifications should be applied to the index before aborting the commit in case of errors. By default, lint-staged will clear all task modifications and revert to the original state.

  • #1550 b27fa3f Thanks @iiroj! - Lint-staged now ignores symlinks and leaves them out from the list of staged files.

Patch Changes

  • #1558 c37dc38 Thanks @iiroj! - The minimum required Node.js version is lowered to 20.17 following nano-spawn@1.0.2.
Changelog

Sourced from lint-staged's changelog.

16.1.0

Minor Changes

  • #1536 e729daa Thanks @iiroj! - A new flag --no-revert has been introduced for when task modifications should be applied to the index before aborting the commit in case of errors. By default, lint-staged will clear all task modifications and revert to the original state.

  • #1550 b27fa3f Thanks @iiroj! - Lint-staged now ignores symlinks and leaves them out from the list of staged files.

Patch Changes

  • #1558 c37dc38 Thanks @iiroj! - The minimum required Node.js version is lowered to 20.17 following nano-spawn@1.0.2.
Commits
  • f92caaa chore(changeset): release
  • e729daa feat: add "--no-revert" flag to disable reverting to original state in case o...
  • c37dc38 fix: lower minimum required Node.js version to 20.17
  • 48f778f build(deps): update dependencies
  • b27fa3f feat: leave out symlinks from list of staged files
  • a941f2c docs: add table of contents section to README.md (#1555)
  • See full diff in compare view

You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---

**URL:** https://haafedk2.com

**Problem:**
My website was previously added to AdGuard's filters (possibly `BaseFilter` or `antiadblock.txt`) due to misclassification or use of ad-related scripts. These issues have been resolved. The website is now clean and compliant with security standards.

It has already been cleared by:
- Google Safe Browsing
- VIPRE
- CRDF
- PhishTank
- X-Force IBM
- ESET and others

Please review and remove `haafedk2.com` from any filter lists (e.g., BaseFilter, antiadblock.txt) to restore normal functionality for AdGuard users.

Thank you!

pull_request.title: Bump lint-staged from 16.0.0 to 16.1.0
pull_request.body:
Bumps [lint-staged](https://github.com/lint-staged/lint-staged) from 16.0.0 to 16.1.0.
Release notes

Sourced from lint-staged's releases.

v16.1.0

Minor Changes

  • #1536 e729daa Thanks @iiroj! - A new flag --no-revert has been introduced for when task modifications should be applied to the index before aborting the commit in case of errors. By default, lint-staged will clear all task modifications and revert to the original state.

  • #1550 b27fa3f Thanks @iiroj! - Lint-staged now ignores symlinks and leaves them out from the list of staged files.

Patch Changes

  • #1558 c37dc38 Thanks @iiroj! - The minimum required Node.js version is lowered to 20.17 following nano-spawn@1.0.2.
Changelog

Sourced from lint-staged's changelog.

16.1.0

Minor Changes

  • #1536 e729daa Thanks @iiroj! - A new flag --no-revert has been introduced for when task modifications should be applied to the index before aborting the commit in case of errors. By default, lint-staged will clear all task modifications and revert to the original state.

  • #1550 b27fa3f Thanks @iiroj! - Lint-staged now ignores symlinks and leaves them out from the list of staged files.

Patch Changes

  • #1558 c37dc38 Thanks @iiroj! - The minimum required Node.js version is lowered to 20.17 following nano-spawn@1.0.2.
Commits
  • f92caaa chore(changeset): release
  • e729daa feat: add "--no-revert" flag to disable reverting to original state in case o...
  • c37dc38 fix: lower minimum required Node.js version to 20.17
  • 48f778f build(deps): update dependencies
  • b27fa3f feat: leave out symlinks from list of staged files

Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. issue.title: mainichi.jp

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@list-kr/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/issues).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://notapplicable.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fnotapplicable.com) ### Comment > The Boostrap DNS servers are ignored on AdGuard Home when resolving the Fallback DNS servers. > After an occurrence where the only main Upstream DNS server failed to respond, AdGuard Home then queried to local dnsmasq on OpenWrt to resolve the Fallback servers. > The local dnsmasq then forwarded the query back to AdGuard Home which blocked the query since the Fallback servers are in a blocklist (to prevent DNS bypass). > The Bootstrap servers need to be used for Fallback as well. > ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/7934y52z5ickg0wkosok4cosgcswwscpa0ibmxplas.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/cfgoxxi1jogks4cs4s4ow480coc8c802zgf13piu76.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS DNS setup: | AdGuard Home DNS server: | AdGuard DNS Default server System version: | OpenWrt Chaos Calmer 15.05.1 Browser: | Not applicable Blocklists: | Security:
HaGeZi's Encrypted DNS/VPN/TOR/Proxy Bypass
